results.title: Metformin protects lens epithelial cells against senescence in a naturally aged mouse model
results.text_hl: This study aimed to assess the underlying mechanism of the formation of @<m>DISEASE_Cataract_Age_Related_Nuclear</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563333 @@@ARC@@@ and investigate the potential anti-ageing effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (@GENE_SLTM @GENE_79811 @@@MET@@@) on @<m>DISEASE_Cataract_Age_Related_Nuclear</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563333 @@@ARC@@@.

citations.NLM: Chen M, Fu Y, Wang X, Wu R, Su D, Zhou N, Qi Y. Metformin protects lens epithelial cells against senescence in a naturally aged mouse model Cell Death Discov. 2022 Jan 10;8(1):8. PMID: 35013152
citations.BibTeX: @article{35013152, title={Metformin protects lens epithelial cells against senescence in a naturally aged mouse model}, author={Chen M and Fu Y and Wang X and Wu R and Su D and Zhou N and Qi Y}, journal={Cell Death Discov}, volume={8}, number={1}, pages={8}}

results.title: Metformin alleviates oxidative stress-induced senescence of human lens epithelial cells via AMPK activation and autophagic flux restoration
results.text_hl: The purpose of this study was to investigate whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ could alleviate the occurrence and development of @<m>DISEASE_Cataract_Age_Related_Nuclear</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563333 @@@age-related cataract@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Cataract_Age_Related_Nuclear</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563333 @@@ARC@@@) and the underlying mechanism.

citations.NLM: Chen M, Zhang C, Zhou N, Wang X, Su D, Qi Y. Metformin alleviates oxidative stress-induced senescence of human lens epithelial cells via AMPK activation and autophagic flux restoration J Cell Mol Med. 2021 Sep;25(17):8376-8389. PMID: 34296521
citations.BibTeX: @article{34296521, title={Metformin alleviates oxidative stress-induced senescence of human lens epithelial cells via AMPK activation and autophagic flux restoration}, author={Chen M and Zhang C and Zhou N and Wang X and Su D and Qi Y}, journal={J Cell Mol Med}, volume={25}, number={17}, pages={8376-8389}}

results.title: Mitochondrial dysfunction in mandibular hypoplasia, deafness and progeroid features with concomitant lipodystrophy (MDPL) patients
results.text_hl: Pharmacological treatment of these cells with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ suggested that the drug is able to restore @<m>DISEASE_Cataract_Age_Related_Nuclear</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563333 @@@nuclear abnormalities@@@, but none of the @DISEASE_Mitochondrial_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D028361 @@@mitochondrial alterations@@@.

citations.NLM: Murdocca M, Spitalieri P, Cappello A, Colasuonno F, Moreno S, Candi E, D'Apice MR, Novelli G, Sangiuolo F. Mitochondrial dysfunction in mandibular hypoplasia, deafness and progeroid features with concomitant lipodystrophy (MDPL) patients Aging (Albany NY). 2022 Feb 23;14(4):1651-1664. PMID: 35196257

results.title: Metformin alleviates ageing cellular phenotypes in Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome dermal fibroblasts.
results.text_hl: In this study, we investigated whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ could exert a beneficial effect on @<m>DISEASE_Cataract_Age_Related_Nuclear</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563333 @@@nuclear abnormalities@@@ and delay senescence in fibroblasts derived from @DISEASE_Progeria @DISEASE_MESH:D011371 @@@HGPS@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Park SK, Shin OS. Metformin alleviates ageing cellular phenotypes in Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome dermal fibroblasts. Exp Dermatol. 2017 Oct;26(10):889-895. PMID: 28192606
